description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model control run climatology by Newtonian cooling over the North Atlantic (10N-60N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present.
name: RestoreSSTclimNAtlantic
rationale: Control for Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomaly perturbations.
longName: Restore north Atlantic sea surface temperature to model climatology
keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, climatology, north Atlantic
